instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
threads.message:
Hi everyone,


Got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a (mba 2017) badly water damage that wasnt turning on. Now all repaired, reballed SMC and now it work fine, all main lines are ok except of PPBUS is 8.2V.

SMC is already reballed. ANother issue is that it doesnt detect the battery.


Any idea where to check? All that was burnt damaged had been replaced.


Thanks.


P.S: ISL625 pins 17/18 and 27/28 are ok 4ohms and 20 ohms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
threads.message: You very likely have a bad SMC PPBUS should be 8.56. Try a new SMC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 52529"]You very likely have a bad SMC PPBUS should be 8.56. Try a new SMC[/QUOTE]

I guess that SMC cant be replaced. I remember that informaticos told it in some posts. Can you confirm? 


Also <SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> 0.2  and BMON 5V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
threads.message: You CAN replace the SMC MUST come from an identical donor board. So you need to pull one from an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> donor board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
threads.message:
Check first diode mode and voltage on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Do you get orange light on Magsafe conector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR>/81 pin 2 in diode mode (red to ground) are both 0.530. Yes i get green than orange as light. 


PS Voltages : SDA - 3.4V and SCL 2.7V. 

Computer boots with charger plugged and run from battery but in system it's not recognized. But it doesnt turn on with only battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
threads.message:
"SDA - 3.4V and SCL 2.7V"
If diode readings are equals, then likely SMC issue.
However, change <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
threads.message: can one tell me if macbook air 2015 and 2017's smcs are same? BOth boards are <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a but after putting 2015's smc on 2017 board it doest give me green light ( PPBUS is now 8.6

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
threads.message: 820-xxxx code is what you need to match every time when replace a SMC from donor board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
threads.message:
Well, tried new smc and seems that donor board is already had SMC fucked. I have no more donor boards. 

Can anyone tell me if this [URL]https://es.aliexpress.com/item/1000007421367.html?spm=a2g0o.productlist.0.0.f4ae72718BCSFw&algo_pvid=5f717bc1-4bb8-4116-857a-fbe8cc96c39f&algo_expid=5f717bc1-4bb8-4116-857a-fbe8cc96c39f-0&btsid=134e41da-ad0c-4a27-966f-7adf9e2b93ac&ws_ab_test=searchweb0_0,searchweb201602_8,searchweb201603_52[/URL] is already programmed and can be installed? Any other place to get SMCs programmed. 

It's SMC fail because puttin one generic it starts but graphics are 5MB:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.2 and battery not deteced.
threads.message: No bad bad idea. Only order donor boards and pull it yourself. Waste of time to buy "new" SMCs. Probably bullshit.
